pullRequest.body:
Adds API for localizing algebra maps, in general form and specialized to `IsLocalization.Away`. Also shows that localization commutes with kernels.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

Sorry forgot about this PR.
Please merge master in case the localization refactor causes some conflicts.
Anything else I should address? @erdOne
I opened #14751 with the changes to the two files removed.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14751~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks!
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10031832565/job/27722727991)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10031832565/job/27722728438)

I've reviewed everything except `Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Algebra.lean` and `Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Finiteness.lean`. If you split the rest into a new PR I'll happily maintainer merge it after the comments are addressed.
Isn't this just `IsLocalization.map_eq`?
Modulo `IsScalarTower.algebraMap_eq`, yes. But also only with `erw`. Changed.
This should mention `Away` in its name. maybe `awayMap‚Çê`, and the one below `Localization.awayMap‚Çê`.
This is already in the `IsLocalization.Away` namespace (analogous to `IsLocalization.Away.map`). The one below is already called as you suggest.

```suggestion
    x ‚àà M'.localized' S p f ‚Üî ‚àÉ m ‚àà M', ‚àÉ s : p, IsLocalizedModule.mk' f m s = x := Iff.rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma RingHom.ker_fg_of_localizationSpan (t : Set R) (ht : Ideal.span t = ‚ä§)
```
Are there better places for these to go?
I moved them.

Can you add this instance so that this becomes automatic?
```
instance {f : A ‚Üí+* B} (a : A) [Away (f a) B‚Çö] : IsLocalization (.map f (.powers a)) B‚Çö := by simpa
```

```suggestion
    simp [algebraMap_mk' (S := A), algebraMap_mk' (S := B), map_mk']‚ü©
```
Should `R‚Çö` `A‚Çö` `B‚Çö` be explicit here?
I think you should first specialize `Module.Finite.of_localizationSpan'` into taking `(I.map (algebraMap R (Away r)).FG` and showing `I.FG`, and then use this lemma.
Done.

IMO a better way here is (needs `import Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Ideal`)
```
lemma IsLocalization.mk'_mem_map_algebraMap (I : Ideal R) (x : R) (s : M) :
    IsLocalization.mk' S x s ‚àà I.map (algebraMap R S) ‚Üî ‚àÉ s ‚àà M, s * x ‚àà I := by
  rw [‚Üê Ideal.unit_mul_mem_iff_mem _ (IsLocalization.map_units S s), IsLocalization.mk'_spec',
    IsLocalization.mem_map_algebraMap_iff M]
  simp_rw [‚Üê map_mul, IsLocalization.eq_iff_exists M, mul_comm x, ‚Üê mul_assoc, ‚Üê Submonoid.coe_mul]
  exact ‚ü®fun ‚ü®‚ü®y, t‚ü©, c, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, (c * t).2, h ‚ñ∏ I.mul_mem_left c.1 y.2‚ü©, fun ‚ü®s, hs, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶
    ‚ü®‚ü®‚ü®_, h‚ü©, ‚ü®s, hs‚ü©‚ü©, 1, by simp‚ü©‚ü©

lemma IsLocalization.ker_map (hT : Submonoid.map g M = T) :
    RingHom.ker (IsLocalization.map Q g (hT.symm ‚ñ∏ M.le_comap_map) : S ‚Üí+* Q) =
      (RingHom.ker g).map (algebraMap R S) := by
  ext x
  obtain ‚ü®x, s, rfl‚ü© := IsLocalization.mk'_surjective M x
  simp [RingHom.mem_ker, IsLocalization.map_mk', IsLocalization.mk'_eq_zero_iff,
    IsLocalization.mk'_mem_map_algebraMap, ‚Üê hT]
```
and then show that `I.map (algebraMap R S)` is the localization of `I` (unsure if we have it or not).
Please check if what I did was what you wanted.
Can this be an instance?
I don't think so since `S` can't be inferred (it says `cannot find synthesization order for instance @toKerLocalized_isLocalizedModule with type ...`)

```suggestion
    ker g ‚Üí‚Çó[R] ker (IsLocalizedModule.map p f f' g) :=
  f.restrict (fun x hx ‚Ü¶ by simp [LinearMap.mem_ker, LinearMap.mem_ker.mp hx])
```
Not tested
Works as is! (Irrelevant side node: Lean needs a `noncomputable` with your version (since `IsLocalizedModule.map` is `noncomputable`), but not with the explicit one. Is this expected?)
Can you provide a version `LinearMap.ker (IsLocalizedModule.map p f f' g) = ((LinearMap.ker g).localized' S p f).restrictScalars _`?

```suggestion
def idealMap (I : Ideal R) : I ‚Üí‚Çó[R] I.map (algebraMap R S) :=
  (Algebra.linearMap R S).restrict (q := (I.map (algebraMap R S)).restrictScalars R)
    (fun _ ‚Ü¶ Ideal.mem_map_of_mem)
```
Not tested.

```suggestion
open IsLocalization in
variable (M S) in
/-- The span of `I` in a localization of `R` at `M` is the localization of `I` at `M`. -/
instance Algebra.idealMap_isLocalizedModule (I : Ideal R) :
    IsLocalizedModule M (Algebra.idealMap I (S := S)) where
  map_units x :=
    (Module.End_isUnit_iff _).mpr ‚ü®fun a b e ‚Ü¶ Subtype.ext ((map_units S x).mul_right_injective
      (by simpa [Algebra.smul_def] using congr(($e).1))),
      fun a ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®‚ü®_, Ideal.mul_mem_left _ (map_units S x).unit‚Åª¬π.1 a.2‚ü©,
        Subtype.ext (by simp [Algebra.smul_def, ‚Üê mul_assoc])‚ü©‚ü©
  surj' y :=
    have ‚ü®x, hx‚ü© := (mem_map_algebraMap_iff M S).mp y.property
    ‚ü®x, Subtype.ext (by simp [Submonoid.smul_def, Algebra.smul_def, mul_comm, hx])‚ü©
  exists_of_eq h := ‚ü®_, Subtype.ext (exists_of_eq congr(($h).1)).choose_spec‚ü©
```
If you enjoy golfs.
This should go near `IsLocalization.map`

This needs `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Ideal` (and the `Localization.Basic` file does not even know kernels of ring homs). The `Ideal` file does not currently talk about `IsLocalization.map`, should I still move it there?

I think putting it in the `Ideal` file makes sense.

Edit: Maybe it's fine to keep it here.
Okay, I leave it here then.

```suggestion
  exact Module.Finite.of_localizationSpan' t ht k (fun g ‚Ü¶ Module.Finite.iff_fg.mpr (H g))
```
Should `R‚Çö A‚Çö B‚Çö` be explicit in this?

```suggestion
    ((map‚Çê M f : A‚Çö ‚Üí‚Çê[R‚Çö] B‚Çö) : A‚Çö ‚Üí B‚Çö) = map B‚Çö f.toRingHom (algebraMapSubmonoid_le_comap M f) :=
```
Can you move this before `map‚Çê`?
